content.description:
Up the obvious two-feet-wide left-facing corner. 

  As of 2015 there is an old worn + faded nylon sling hanging down from above the top of the corner.
content.protection: No bolts.    Protection for trad leading is unknown.
content.location:
Below obvious two-feet-wide left-facing corner, on top of fallen detached flake leaning against the Left side of the obvious wall facing northeast toward the interior of the Library. 

  Getting there from the Right side of the back wall and from the interior of the Library    is usually done by scrambling up a slanted fallen tree trunk on the left (northeast) side of the big fallen flakes standing vertically.

content.description: Start at bottom of face next to detached vertical flake - (or could start from top of detached flakes).   Follow the bolts, roughly up the middle of the face.
content.protection:
2 bolts - but no top anchor bolts. 

  Top-Rope can be set up on flat top of block using static line.
content.location: Fallen flakes standing vertically below the obvious northeast face of the smaller detached block which is southeast (left) from the detached Main Block.

content.description:
Up the arete. 

  . (the Holzman print guidebook 2011 edition has the difficulty as 5.11c).
content.protection: Bolts - but perhaps no top anchor.
content.location: Arete on right edge of the obvious northeast face of the smaller detached block which is to the southeast (left) from the detached Main Block.    This arete forms the left edge of the entrance to an obvious wide chimney between the Main Block and the smaller detached SouthEast Block.

content.description:
There is another much smaller detached block just southeast from the detached Main Block, separated by an obvious wide chimney.   (It is possible to step across carefully between the tops of these two blocks). 

  "Back wall" is the obvious northeast side of this block which faces the interior of the Library, with a couple of big detached flakes standing vertically at its base.
